comments.commentBody: Many will vote for their choice but will not reveal who the person will be.  People will vote for who they feel is best for them and who will help them.  What is the most important issue for you may be totally different for your neighbor.

I still do not get this.
I must be dense.
Trump doesn't even have 40% of the vote.
SIXTY PERCENT of GOP Voters are Just Saying NO to Trump.
True, Cruz, Kasich and Rubio are doing worse but in the aggregate, "SOMEONE ELSE" is winning.

Do the GOP want someone who the majority of their OWN voters don't want?
IF he can't manage a substantive, or even a bare, majority of GOP primary voters -- how can he possibly win the general election.

SIXTY THREE per cent of Republican/Republican leaning voters say they want an open convention to stop Trump.

GOP has never, ever been good at reading handwriting on the wall, but gee, these seem to be 1000-foot high letters.

I was unaware that we were not supposed to be noticing the collapse of the Rubio campaign.

Especially in the context of leaving angry establishment Republican overlords with their best hope of avoiding Trump, who will rub victory in their faces and shout about endlessly how he won without needing their help and despite their attempts to defeat him, is their own hated Ted Cruz, who will also rub his victory in their faces and shout about endlessly how he won without needing their help and despite their attempts to defeat him.

Really, their best hope is a noble defeat of a reasonable John Kasich run at the office.

Kasich follows some important rules of the corporate meeting:
(1) The less you say, the better you sound.
(2) Always be the last person to speak. (Let the others take the risks.)
(3) Suggest forming a committee.
Once Republicans hear his positions on trade, immigration, Social Security, Common Core, Syria, and so on, they’ll stop listening to his silence.

I am totally flummoxed as to how the GOP establishment continues to shoot itself in the foot.  Shaking the mothballs off of Mitt ("47%") Romney and befuddled Newt Gingrich and have them lob verbal ping pong balls at Trump screamed "Desperation" louder than a contestant on "the Bachelor".  They have no idea that Trump voters are now boycotting Fox News because of their perceived poor treatment of their hero Donald.  Trumpians don't get their news from National Review, The Weekly Standard or WSJ; no, it's Breitbart, Drudge Report and loonier sites than that, because they supposedly "tell the truth" (appeal to their personal prejudices).  Get your interns to do some real homework and quit getting the feel of the country from listening to each other at wine-and-cheese tastings and talking to academics in think tanks.  That's been your modus operandi, and look what's happened.

I think the interesting story is the utter collapse of Rubio, and what this says about the instincts of both the Republican establishment and the political press corps, which have assured us for months that, when all is said and done, Rubio would be the guy.

I understand why the GOP elite was saying it, I don't understand why the press went along with it for so long. The media clung to the story line even as early state results were indicating Rubio was not catching fire with the voters.

Any American woman who votes for DT must move to Afghanistan because that's where his kind of thoughts about women flourish.  He is the worst kind of cave-man type non-thinking man.  Time to Grow Up, Women of America.
I am wondering about the prospect of President Trump handing out courtesy gifts to heads of state that include Trump water, wine and steak to augment his reduced salary of $400K.

Yesterday was a day when a spectacular volcano erupted. That volcano which has been dormant for the past 8 years could be characterized as "people power". The press, politicians and pundits were left in the dust.

It's all about the economy!  At one time in a place that seems  far far away the unemployment rate could be a true barometer of how the middle class was doing but today it's fantasy numbers.  it shows nothing about how we the middle class are getting jobs that offer 1/3 of the pay and no form of job security.  The type of security that companies unofficially gave american workers.  With Tim Cook of Apple, other corporate leaders and the GOP power brokers coming together to somehow buy an election because they fear a candidates message that America come first will effect their profits how can we not be attracted to Thrumps message?

replies.commentBody: Whoa!  John and Marco are not moderates by any standard, and no moderate, once they look at what policies these two advocate, would vote for them.
Girish, the logic might be that 4th minus 3rd = 1st.

Kasich/Rubio 2016?
Why? Were Jon Huntsman and Bobby Jindal busy?

Boehner/McCain 2016
Gowdy/King 2016

Haha!

comments.commentBody: Kasich/Rubio 2016.  Make the deal and the announcement now.  Neither Trump nor Cruz can win in the general.  There's a huge moderate - a.k.a. reasonable, not extreme right or left - voting block out there who will flock in droves to a like-minded (i.e. sane) alternative.  John-Marco, do it now.  Please!

replies.commentBody: Trump did that in response to Romney's claims that Trump was a fraudulent and failed businessman, not to hawk his products, as the media wants you to believe. Really, that was another loser move by Romney.

comments.commentBody:
"Mr. Trump, plugging several of his business interests in a victory speech that seemed straight out of QVC"

Trump Cabernet: bitter tannins, tar/leather, horrific nose, very short on finish

Trump T-bone: Grizzly, all sizzle no steak, tho well marbled

" There it was Mr. Kasich who benefited most from Mr. Rubio’s voters, who are presumably more moderate than they are in the South"

If they did not vote for Rubio while he's still in the race, what exactly makes them "Rubio's voters" ? The assumption seems to be that default choice ought to be Rubio, so what we're seeing now, can only be framed as a deviation from the default choice.
It's deeply satisfying to see the panic amongst NYT reporters in realizing that their worldview isn't shared by majority of the voters.

replies.commentBody: Andrew -- they are giving the elites the finger by voting Trump.  Poetic justice, really - the elites gave everyone else the finger these many years - now it is payback time.

comments.commentBody: People are voting for Trump because they think it's funny.  Little do they realize into what danger they're putting the world in so doing.

replies.commentBody:
"...ignoring the will of the people."

Are you aware that the Founding Fathers had strong reservations about "the will of the people?" That's why the US Constitution stated that US senators were to be elected by state legislatures, and why that same document established the Electoral College for election of the president.

Trump's popularity bolsters those reservations.
And for the record, the US is not a democracy, and the Founders never meant it to be. It's a republic - which, unfortunately, appears to be devolving into an oligarchy.

comments.commentBody: It is simple, in a democracy, majority rules so Trump should win the nomination.  No elites, no super delegates no rules to make the establishment pick who they want ignoring the will of the people.

I'm for trump. I've voted as a democrat for all of my adult life. But Hillary or Bernie seem to be more of the same. beltway insiders or k street wannabe,s. I lost my home to foreclosure in 2011. The bank did not want to help. The tarp funds available were not even close to being within reach. No financial fraudster,s were held accountable. This country poured trillions down the drain to help Afghanistan and Pakistan who cannot help their own people, but were adept at helping  themselves to our blood and especially treasure. The senate and congress is nothing more than a special good ol boys club harnessed to all the special interests this country is willing to offer. I mean, COME ON! How long is this form of governance going to continue to rot from the inside out. The most obvious such as global warming, excessive firearms, general paranoia fed by our vaunted news sources and a sense that it's every family for themselves does not even register to anybody, anywhere,anytime. It no longer feels like the usual suspects are any different or will do anything any different than the former suspects. For me the trump vote is the equivalent of sticking my head out the window of my apartment and yelling, " I,m mad as hell and I,m not going to take it any more.

I am not sure why some believe that the "anyone but Trump"  vote makes sense. Although both Trump and Cruz are not attractive candidates  in the minds of moderate republicans , Cruz appears to be far  more extreme and inflexible than Trump.

replies.commentBody: Didn't Charles M. Blow hypothesize that Carson was really running to sell his life story more than to become president?  If Blow's correct, then Trump is merely in line with contemporary Republican campaign tactics.  Trump may be incendiary, but he's evidently not Carson-o-genic.

comments.commentBody: So what is Trump running for?  The President of the US or of QVC?  The Trump spectacle continues on.  For Trump it is all about the sale and not the substance.  It is a sad commentary that some Republicans are so desperate that they fall for his Schick.  After all who can seriously vote for a candidate that hawks steaks and vodka during his victory speech?

replies.commentBody:
So let him go own a football team and make himself the honorary QB-- and keep him out of foreign policy and making decisions about wars.
He'll take over Mexico to make them build a wall. He'll invade China to force them to do whatever with currency. Middle East -- blow it up.
The soldiers who die in these conflicts are our sons and daughters. He dodged the draft and his rich kids would never fight.

comments.commentBody:
It may be that a lot of people will be eating their fair share of crow pie (and I mean the whole bird: feathers, head, beak and all) including all the smug right wing radio hosts: Levin, Limbaugh, Medved, et al, too many TV pundits to mention, Karl Rove and all the other apparatchiks of the Republican Party.

You have to give the man his due. After what was (and continues to be) the most concerted media attack on a presidential candidate by his own party in HISTORY he's shown more sheer courage than all of them put together, breaking multiple gang tackles in an unparalleled feat of political broken field running . . .and I mean broken field!
Little by little the only sensible Rep candidate, gov.Kasich, is gaining ground as more clowns are left in the gutter.two more to dispose of.

But for the Romney led pile on against Mr. Trump and the establishment's hissy fit tirades against Trump, the base of the GOP might have wearied of the Donald on its own terms. We shall never know. But if your like many Americans, you do know when someone is insulting you - and you either fight back or slink away from the insults. The audacious hypocrisy of the GOP to front Romney and Ryan against Trump's support among the middle class was just too odious an insult for the GOP base.

The Republican party's base is fighting back against the establishment. They want change as much as the Sanders supporters want change.

Ideologues are so yesterday when the middle class is hungry and hurting.

Another Big Night for The Donald!  Nice piece, Nate.  Looks like prognosticating that Trump will win the nod from RNC Convention in Cleveland in 5 months is a possibility.  Amazing that his brand, not just his name, but his demented charisma which has drawn his following of couch potatoes, low-info folk, white supremacists, and all manner of Americans like bees to his hive is still working! Rubio is dust, toast, and Kasich and Cruz aren't going to rack up a lot of delegates in coming primaries and caucuses. I am not of the Trump suasion but it is fascinating to see this loud boorish braggart take on the US States in caucuses and primaries as he took on the Scottish folk with his golf-course on part of Menie estate in Aberdeenshire.  He bloviated that it would be "The world's greatest golf course!".  And then after the balloon ran out of hot air, he took josmarbles and said he'd build a golf course in Ireland, even though his Mother was Scottish.  If Trump wins, when Trump wins,  golf will become the national pastime for all but the illegal aliens and American untermenschen who will be groundskeepers and caddies from here to eternity.  Unless Bernie Sanders or Hillary Clinton has "A Big Night" next November!
40% more Republican have voted in primaries than Democrats. That is millions of people. Trump wins in November.
Hey Mitt..How bout a nice Trump steak and a glass of Trump wine to go with your crow?

replies.commentBody: Why waste your vote ? Vote for the ticket of Pres Clinton the 2nd and VP Sanders. Then kick out the obstructionist in toto and let the good times roll, open the doors for a come back by the Unions, the protective tariffs , higher minimum wages, our aircraft  and car factories, fair taxes paid by the 1% and lo and behold a return of the middlle classes and no more poverty and empty jails...Wake up core Republicans

comments.commentBody: Trump has been very successful at "gaming the system" --- buying politicians and declaring bankruptcies to insure HE personally did not lose. The only "losers" in Trump's world were those that invested in his failed ventures and the thousands of employees that worked at his companies getting laid off due to the bankruptcies. I will be voting for the "only adult" in this candidate mix with a successful background at governing a state and getting finances in order .....Mr. Kasich.
